title: Leaked documents warn of weaknesses in Ukraine’s defenses
description: The apparent leak of classified U.S. documents includes briefing slides indicating Ukraine's air defenses often struggle to keep up with Russian salvos.

title: Ben Ferencz, last living Nuremberg prosecutor, dies at 103
description: At 27, he prosecuted Nazis for more than 1 million deaths in perhaps the largest murder case in history.

title: Yemen: Saudis free 13 Houthis as Omani officials visit Sanaa
description: Yemen’s Houthi rebels say Saudi Arabia released 13 war prisoners

title: Israelis protest judicial overhaul despite violence surge
description: Thousands of Israelis gathered for a weekly demonstration against the government’s contentious judicial overhaul plans despite security concerns stemming from a surge in Israeli-Palestinian violence

title: Israel beefs up security for Jerusalem religious ceremonies
description: Israel’s defense minister has extended a closure barring entrance to Israel for Palestinians from the occupied West Bank and Gaza Strip for the duration of the Jewish holiday of Passover, while police are preparing forces in Jerusalem on the eve of sensitive religious celebrations

title: At least 44 people killed by jihadis in Burkina Faso's north
description: Burkina Faso’s government says that at least 44 people were killed by Islamic extremists in multiple attacks in the country’s north

title: Pope Francis returns to public eye for Easter vigil Mass
description: Pope Francis is presiding over Easter vigil Mass at the Vatican

title: Show stopper: Singalong fans ejected, 'Bodyguard' halted
description: A British performance of “The Bodyguard” musical screeched to a halt when unruly audience members couldn’t refrain from singing along to the finale

title: Afghan religious scholars criticize girls' education ban
description: Afghan religious scholars say the government’s ban on girls’ education is un-Islamic

title: Israel’s Netanyahu slammed by far right after week of violence, rocket strikes
description: Far-right officials condemned Benjamin Netanyahu's response to rocket strikes with Lebanon and attacks on civilians in the West Bank and Tel Aviv. An anti-government rally is set to go ahead.

title: China health officials lash out at WHO, defend virus search
description: Chinese health officials have defended their search for the source of the COVID-19 virus and lashed out at the World Health Organization after its leader said Beijing should have shared genetic and other information earlier

title: Evan Gershkovich adored life in Russia. Now, the reporter waits in prison.
description: Friends and colleagues who spoke to The Washington Post emphasized how they want to do whatever they can to help free the Wall Street Journal reporter.

title: Iraq, Syria's Kurdish leader condemn attack on airport
description: The commander of the main U.S.-backed force in Syria and Iraq’s presidency have condemned what they say was a Turkish attack on an airport in northern Iraq

title: What is the Good Friday Agreement?
description: Twenty-five years ago the Good Friday Agreement largely ended three decades of violence in Northern Ireland. What is its legacy in a post-Brexit world?

title: Truck crashes into pedestrians in Kenya, killing 10
description: A truck has crashed into pedestrians and motorcycle taxis near western Kenya’s border with Tanzania, killing at least 10 people and injuring 10 others

title: US deploys guided-missile submarine amid tensions with Iran
description: The U.S. Navy has dispatched a guided-missile submarine capable of carrying up to 154 Tomahawk missiles to the Middle East

title: On canvas, Iranian artists capture the hope and turmoil of an uprising
description: As protests rocked Iran, The Washington Post connected with three artists in the country who spoke about how the uprising had inspired their work.

title: Chinese military starts drills encircling Taiwan after Tsai’s U.S. visits
description: The operation intensifies an initially relatively restrained reaction to Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen's Wednesday meeting with House Speaker Kevin McCarthy.

title: In Morocco, no city can match Tangier’s famous cafe culture
description: How to explore one of the top cafe cities in the world, from a bluff perched over the Strait of Gibraltar to a renovated cinema on the main square.

title: In Africa's Okavango, oil drilling disrupts locals, nature
description: In Africa’s Okavango delta, drilling for oil exploration, as well as human-caused climate change leading to more erratic rainfall patterns and water abstraction and diversion for development and commercial agriculture, has altered the landscape that so many people and wildlife species rely on

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kyiv moves to prevent release of defense plans; U.S. to probe document leak
description: U.S. officials said many of the leaked documents did not appear to be forged, while Ukraine suggested that they appeared to show "fictitious information."

title: Facing critical ammunition shortage, Ukrainian troops ration shells
description: As the United States and other backers scramble to manufacture or buy more shells for Ukraine, Kyiv's forces are choosing targets carefully.

title: Mexican artisans create 'Judas' figures for others to burn
description: During the “Burning of Judas” celebrations that take place every Holy Saturday in some Mexican neighborhoods, people gather to light fireworks that destroy colorful figures embodying evil
